result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

SEE SIGNATURE BOND FOR CONDITIONS

BOND TO COVER 22GF1023, 22CF530, 22CF411, 22CF234, 21CF111, 22CF232, & 22CF311

DEFENDANT MUST POST $2000 CASH
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH PRETRIAL SERVICES. Contact with victim as permitted in 22CV177. Defendant may contact victim through phone calls or text messages while defendant is in custody. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH R.F. (dob 1/6/1982) OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

records.addlTxt: Not guilty plea by reason of mental disease or defect entered and trial reserved.

8:31am Court in session

Defendant Matthew Voight present in court, in custody with attorney Steven Spear. ADA Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Matter is set for a preliminary hearing, Deft wishes to have a hearing.

State calls Officer Shaun Sowa, duly sworn & testifies on direct by ADA Herrmann. Record to reflect identification of Deft by Officer Sowa. 
State introduces previously marked exhibit #1, criminal complaint for 22CF232, into evidence. 
No objection by Atty Spear. Court receives exhibit #1
No Cross-Exam by Atty Spear
Officer Sowa excused. 

State calls Officer Xenia Rodriguez, duly sworn & testifies on direct by ADA Herrmann. State introduces previously marked exhibit #1, criminal complaint for 22CF311, into evidence. Record to reflect identification of Deft by Officer Rodriguez. No objection by Atty Spear to the Court receiving exhibit #1. Court receives.
No cross-exam by Atty Spear.
Officer Rodriguez excused.

State calls Officer Antonio Gonzalez, duly sworn & testifies on direct by ADA Herrmann. Record to reflect identification of Deft by Officer Gonzalez. State introduces previously marked exhibit #1, criminal complaint for 22CF234, into  evidence. No objection by Atty Spear. Court receives.
No cross-exam by Atty Spear
Officer Gonzalez excused. 

No defense witnesses.

Record is closed.

Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed & that the Deft likely committed it & binds him over to stand trial on the charges.
State makes record that informations will mirror complaints.

Defense proceeds with arraignment today.
Court orders NGI Exam.

Motion to modify bond by Defense.
State objects, further argument by ADA Herrmann. 
Response argument by Atty Spear
Deft's significant other present in court. 
Response argument by ADA Herrmann

Court makes record, Court denies bond motion, bond remains at this time.

8:52am Court in recess
Defense Motion to Modify Bond

1:36 PM Case called. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew S. Voight appeared by video. Attorney Jason Daane specially for the purposes of bond. 
Atty Daane has reviewed the NOA and risk assessment. 
State asks for Previous bond to be forfeited with new $10,000 cash bond, same conditions as previous bond. 
Atty Daane gives argument and asks for signature bond with smaller cash component. 
Court grants state's request. 
Bond forfeited and set as requested, same prior conditions.

Spear in court for Matthew S. Voight. Record by Attorney Spear to status of defendant. Attorney is questioning the defendant's competency.
